p: Likewise, the best control capacity obtained for C. winterianus essential oil was achieved for the dose 120 μL on day 15 after application, killing 70.25 ± 4.58% of the adults evaluated. This value was significantly greater (F = 15.73; df = 5.18; p < 0.0001) than for the other doses. The doses 60 and 24 μL were able to kill 59.50 ± 2.46 and 57.75 ± 5.39% of adults respectively, significantly higher than the mortality obtained for the 12 μL and 6 μL doses (43.28 ± 3.19 and 42.68 ± 4.10% of adults died with these doses on day 15th). Control treatment differed significantly from the 5th day after application, in which percentage of mortality was 14.25 ± 2.39% on day 15th ( Figure 1B).
